title: The Recognizer
key_events: Lena calls repeatedly, Adrian doesn't answer
Text conversation where Lena tries to make Adrian understand he's sick
Lena reveals her father's schizophrenia story in detail
Parallel drawn between father's delusions and Adrian's patterns
Lena says goodbye, promises not to call again

character_development.Adrian: Recognizes parallels to Lena's father but believes his experience is different, emotional distance increasing, choosing transformation over relationship
character_development.Lena: Full backstory of father's schizophrenia revealed, her trauma and pattern recognition explained, draws boundary for self-protection

planted_elements: Lena's father's schizophrenia detailed - pays off in Ch37 when she tries to follow Adrian into Change
Her inability to distinguish Adrian's Change from mental illness - creates tragic gap between them
The parallel between delusion and transcendence as indistinguishable from outside
Lena's promise not to call again - makes her reappearance in Ch13/15 more impactful
transformation_stage: Stage 1 - Emotional distancing, choosing pattern over people, recognizing unfalsifiability of his experience
cosmic_horror_elements: The unfalsifiable nature of transformation vs psychosis
Pattern recognition as symptom or superpower
themes: The impossibility of proving sanity from inside possible insanity
Love insufficient to bridge incompatible perceptions of reality
Trauma creating pattern recognition (Lena seeing her father in Adrian)
